document.masterDocTitle: Phytotelmatrichis, a new genus of Acrotrichinae (Coleoptera: Ptiliidae) associated with the phytotelmata of Zingiberales plants in Peru

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Phytotelmatrichis, a new genus of Acrotrichinae (Coleoptera: Ptiliidae) associated with the phytotelmata of Zingiberales plants in Peru

subSubSection.paragraph:
Habitus
Figs. 2 A–B
. Length 0.99–1.05 mm . Colour brown appearing paler on lateral margins and underside of pronotum and posterior margin of the elytra; exposed abdominal segments, legs and antennae dusky yellow. Antennomeres 3–11 0.36–0.41 mm long
Fig. 2 C
. Mentum and submentum chaetotaxy
Fig. 3 B
. Width across eyes 0.39–0.42 mm . Pronotum 0.67–0.71 mm wide, 0.30–0.33 mm long, wider than elytra at shoulders. Elytra 0.58– 0.60 mm long, 0.70–0.76 mm wide, widest across the humeri and with a setae bearing epipleuron stretching to two thirds the length of the elytron and projecting from the lateral border of the mesoventrum
Fig. 2
H. Mesoventral collar not extending onto the humeri, mesoventral process reaching posterior margin of collar, posterior margins straight, sloping anteriorly to lateral margins
Fig.
2
F. Posterior margins of metaventrum straight, sloping anteriorly to lateral margins, metacoxal plates large and rounded, reaching to anterior margins
Fig. 2
G. Pygidium with a small central tooth (often abraided and apparently absent) and two large lateral teeth in the posterior half, longer setae as present in many species of
Acrotrichis
absent, anterior border setiferous
Fig.
3 F
.

Male : aedeagus
Fig. 2 E
; sixth visible ventrite
Fig. 3 C
.

Female : spermatheca with a long narrow duct arising from the same surface of the receptacle as the pump
Fig. 2 D
; sixth visible ventrite with two posteriorly directed setae
Fig. 3 G
.
Etymology . From the name of the country in which the species was found.

Diagnosis . Only likely to be confused with species of
Acrotrichis
and
Actinopteryx
, see above.

Type data
: All specimens from Madre de Dios Dept., ACA-CICRA Field Station,

.

., Coll. Jalinsky, Wertenberger, Radocy, unless otherwise stated.
